TopicTitle: [1.12.5] Bluedog Design Bureau - Stockalike Saturn, Apollo, and more! (v1.13.0 "Забытый" 13/Aug/2023)

Articles.Content:
56 minutes ago, Taco Salad said:

Oh god its HORRIBLE. 
I need it. What's the engine mount from?

 

29 minutes ago, septemberWaves said:

The engine mount looks like it's probably just from Shuttle Orbiter Construction Kit. The part that's very unique is the adapter forward of the engine mount, the one that transforms from space shuttle cross-section to Saturn cross-section; that's the part that I don't know where it's from.

Maybe, though I actually think it might be from @EStreetRockets' ORANGES pack. In any case it looks great!

 

1 hour ago, GoldForest said:

Not a teaser per say, just messing around with KVV

 

Some say it's terrifying, but I happen to be a strong advocate for Apollo-Shuttle hybrids. This has my vote!

1 hour ago, Blufor878 said:

 

Maybe, though I actually think it might be from @EStreetRockets' ORANGES pack. In any case it looks great!

 

Some say it's terrifying, but I happen to be a strong advocate for Apollo-Shuttle hybrids. This has my vote!

It is the mount from ORANGES, not SOCK. 

As for the adapter, it is from ORANGES as well.

All parts are from ORANGES, Rocket Motor Menagerie, BDB or Photon Corp.

 a strong advocate for Apollo-Shuttle hybrids.

Edited May 15 by GoldForest

It's likely not something that'd ever make it to the mod, but I thought I'd share the Lunar Module Test Article as a cursed skinned LM for your perusal.

 

Speaking of things that won't get into the mod, I still don't get the hype around C-8 but even though it's been shot down before I still think an LLRV/LLTV would be very cool to have.

Spoiler

I just think they're a really cool and unique piece of apollo hardware -plus the kitbash potential is incredible!

There's two of them! Both as funky as the other!

23 minutes ago, The Dressian Exploder said:

Speaking of things that won't get into the mod, I still don't get the hype around C-8 but even though it's been shot down before I still think an LLRV would be very cool to have.

BFR. Big Fat Rocket. But replacing Fat... 

Also, Cobalt has said that they may do the big Nova for KSP2... though... lets not talk about that.

Also also, iirc, Cobalt did express that he liked my version of the C-8. Perhaps we could bully, eh I mean   persuade him to do my C-8 has the official BDB C-8.  Though, my C-8 is basically just the c-8 from the c-8 wikipedia page.

Edited May 14 by GoldForest

Made a XB-70 kinda sorta to launch the X-15 Delta.  Currently the X-15 normals/materials/whatever that cool texture thing is called seem messed up.  From a normal distance away, there's like black squares, but zooming in really close makes the X-15 parts look normal.  Work in Production of course

 

No, I can't get the wing tips to fold all the way down.  Using Robotic Hinges is... not good.  These wing tips are Proc canards stretched into the shape, but since control surfaces can only "deploy" to a max of 30 degrees, that's all you get :3

The Snoot Droops

1 hour ago, KeaKaka said:

I updated it to the beta, specifically ORANGES-v1.0.0-beta-2 and I cannot find it.

1 hour ago, Taco Salad said:

I updated it to the beta, specifically ORANGES-v1.0.0-beta-2 and I cannot find it.

You want to download the main branch, not the release branch. 

Go to Oranges forum page.

Click on the Github link.

Click on "< > code"

Hit the green dropdown "< > code" button.

Download zip.

50 minutes ago, GoldForest said:

You want to download the main branch, not the release branch. 

Go to Oranges forum page.

Click on the Github link.

Click on "< > code"

Hit the green dropdown "< > code" button.

Download zip.

Ahh thank you. Clicking the forum link takes me to the dev branches for some reason. Found the main though, thanks!

@Rodger The Super Wide SLA fairing bases don't appear when you type Apollo in the search. I suspect they are missing the Apollo tag. 

Also, I know the Extra folder doesn't get touched really, but would it be possible to get the Fuel Cell extra fixed? Gemini and Apollo don't use the Hydrogen/Oxygen fuel when you select the Hydrogen/Oxygen Fuel cell option.

@Blufor878
